bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I tried to create a notebook called "1.13.1". The site accepted the name, and started the creation UI. After a few minutes of watching a spinning circle, I checked the kubectl logs, and saw "Invalid value: "1.13.1-0": a DNS-1123 label must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-'" What did you expect to happen: The UI should reject any wrong names. It should possibly also show a failure state instead of a progress wheel when creation fails Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.2-rc.1 Kubernetes platform: GKE Kubernetes version: Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.9-gke.7", GitCommit:"b6001a5d99c235723fc19342d347eee4394f2005", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-24T19:37:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8b4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.9-gke.13", GitCommit:"af4778c16fedc428827fa1949c97cf325f4b9f9b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-07-26T03:07:52Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8b4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} OS: macOS
